intro: Borreria molleri, commonly known as the Mexican broom, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Borreria molleri is often found in dry, open habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
